Atul Subhash's Mother Moves Supreme Court for 4-Year-Old Grandson's Custody - NDTV
summary:
Atul Subhash's Mother Goes To Supreme Court For 4-Year-Old Grandson's Custody

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

In a poignant development, the mother of Atul Subhash, a Bengaluru engineer who died by suicide, has approached the Supreme Court for custody of her four-year-old grandson amidst allegations of harassment against Subhash's estranged wife and her family.

  • The case revolves around multiple arrests linked to Subhash's suicide on December 9, which his family claims was prompted by harassment.
  • Anju Modi filed a habeas corpus petition for her grandson, whose whereabouts remain unknown despite claims he is in a boarding school.
  • The Supreme Court has asked the governments of Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, and Karnataka for clarity regarding the child’s location.
  • Nikita Singhania, Subhash's estranged wife, and her family members face charges related to abetment of suicide and are currently in custody.
  • Pawan Kumar, Subhash's father, demands to know the child's whereabouts and custody due to the family's concerns for his safety.
  • There is ongoing legal contention, including anticipatory bail requests concerning Nikita's uncle.
Bikas Kumar, Subhash's brother, stated, "Our fight will continue. We will not immerse the ashes of my brother till we get justice."

The situation highlights serious familial disputes and legal battles regarding the welfare of a young child amidst tragic circumstances.
newTitle: Atul Subhash's Mother Seeks Supreme Court Custody of Grandson

title: Huawei beats Apple, dominates wrist-worn device market for most of 2024: IDC - The Indian Express
summary:
Huawei Beats Apple to Lead Global Wrist-Worn Device Market in 2024

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The wrist-worn device market sees a significant shift as Huawei overtakes Apple to secure the top position for the first three quarters of 2024, driven by robust sales of its GT5 series and blood pressure monitor.

  • Huawei has surpassed Apple in the wrist-worn wearable market for the first three quarters of 2024.
  • The top-selling products include Huawei's GT5, GT5 Pro, and Watch D2, contributing to sales growth across various regions.
  • Apple briefly regained the top spot with the Watch Series 10 but faces challenges in innovation.
  • Xiaomi holds third place with significant growth attributed to the Xiaomi Band 9 and Watch S series.
  • China is the largest market for wrist-worn devices, with 45.8 million units shipped and a 20.1% growth year-over-year.
  • Sales in India and the United States have declined compared to the previous year.
“Huawei has managed to outpace Apple in the wrist-worn device segment.”

This trend highlights Huawei's increasing dominance in the wearable market, emphasizing the need for innovation among competitors like Apple to retain market share.
newTitle: Huawei Beats Apple to Lead Global Wrist-Worn Device Market in 2024

Washington Sundar, blamed for taking R Ashwin's spot, gave 'best' 2-minute speech on India legend's retirement night - Hindustan Times
summary:
Washington Sundar, blamed for taking R Ashwin's spot, gave 'best' 2-minute speech on India legend's retirement night

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The retirement of Indian cricket legend Ravichandran Ashwin has sparked numerous tributes from teammates, including a heartfelt message from Washington Sundar, who has often been seen as Ashwin's successor.

  • Sundar praised Ashwin for his mentorship and support throughout his career.
  • Ashwin announced his retirement after a stellar career with 765 wickets.
  • In a tribute, Ashwin remarked on Sundar's two-minute speech during the retirement celebration.
  • Sundar is expected to fill Ashwin's role in upcoming matches, starting with the Boxing Day Test.
Ashwin’s response to Sundar: “Thupakkiya pudinga washiii! The 2 minutes you spoke that night in the get together was the best.”

This moment highlights the strong bond between the two spinners and sets the stage for Sundar as he steps into Ashwin's shoes.
newTitle: Washington Sundar's Tribute to R Ashwin on Retirement Night

title: Indian-origin illegal immigrant jailed for nearly 5 years as lie unravels in UK Wickes worker assault case - Hindustan Times
summary:
Indian-origin illegal immigrant jailed for nearly 5 years in UK assault case

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Karandeep Singh, an Indian national without legal status in the UK, was sentenced to nearly five years in prison for assaulting a hardware store employee during a robbery attempt.

  • Singh was involved in a violent attack on a Wickes employee in Slough, Berkshire, in May 2023.
  • Initially claiming to be 18 years old, he faced court after failing to attend his trial.
  • The assault resulted in a 9cm head wound for the victim, who subsequently feared returning to work.
  • Singh lied about his age, revealing conflicting information about his identity and background during the court proceedings.
  • He was convicted on robbery and grievous bodily harm charges, receiving a sentence of four years, eight months, and 14 days.
“He does have three alias birthdays on the Police National Computer and he looks to me a little bit older than 19” - Judge Sarah Jane Campbell.

Singh’s case reflects broader issues of immigration status and crime, raising questions about legal accountability and the treatment of immigrants in the UK.
newTitle: Indian-origin illegal immigrant jailed for nearly 5 years in UK assault case

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex tanks over 800 points; Nifty50 near 23,700 - The Times of India
summary:
Stock market today: BSE Sensex tanks over 800 points; Nifty50 near 23,700

Date: Today
Source: Times of India

Indian equity benchmark indices BSE Sensex and Nifty50 faced significant declines today, dipping below 78,500 and just above 23,700 respectively. Key factors include recent comments from the US Federal Reserve affecting investor confidence.

  • BSE Sensex declined by 836 points (1.06%) to 78,382.17.
  • Nifty50 dropped by 241 points (1.01%) to 23,710.95.
  • Foreign investors sold shares worth 122.31 billion rupees ($1.44 billion) this week.
  • Weekly declines of both indices exceed 3%, marking the first drop after four weeks of gains.
  • Top gainers included Asian Paints, Nestle India, and Titan Company, while major losers were Tech Mahindra and Axis Bank.
“Despite the weakness, oversold conditions and resilience in select pockets present buying opportunities.” - Ajit Mishra, SVP, Research, Religare Broking

In conclusion, the current pressure on the stock market can be attributed to global economic conditions, particularly the US Federal Reserve's recent statements on interest rates, prompting caution among investors.
newTitle: Stock Market Update: BSE Sensex Drops Over 800 Points, Nifty50 Nears 23,700

Severe Case Of Bird Flu In The US; Here's What You Should Know - NDTV
summary:
Severe Case Of Bird Flu In The US; Here's What You Should Know

Publication Date: Wednesday, 2024
Source: CDC

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has reported a severe avian influenza infection case in Louisiana, marking the first serious human case in the U.S., bringing the total to 61 infections in the current outbreak.

  • The patient had contact with sick and dead birds.
  • The H5N1 virus was identified with genetic sequencing.
  • Current risk to the public is considered low.
  • Symptoms of bird flu in humans include high fever, severe coughing, and breathing difficulties.
  • Preventive measures include avoiding contact with infected birds and practicing good hygiene.
“This case highlights that wild birds and backyard flocks, along with commercial poultry and dairy operations, can also be sources of infection.” - CDC

It is essential to follow prevention tips to reduce the risk of infection while remaining vigilant for symptoms.
newTitle: Severe Case Of Bird Flu In The US; Here's What You Should Know

Pushpa 2, Stree 2 or Kalki 2898 AD? BookMyShow report reveals which movie sold most tickets in 2024 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pushpa 2 Tops 2024 Ticket Sales According to BookMyShow Report

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

BookMyShow's year-end report reveals that Pushpa 2 is the most-watched movie of 2024, with significant box office success and audience engagement.

  • Pushpa 2: The Rule sold 10.8 lakh solo tickets, becoming the most-watched film of the year.
  • The film is a sequel to the 2021 hit Pushpa: The Rise, featuring Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna.
  • November 1 was a blockbuster day, recording 2.3 million tickets sold in 24 hours.
  • Live entertainment consumption grew by 18% in 2024 with over 30,000 events across 319 cities.
  • Music tourism showed a rise with 477,393 fans traveling for events, indicating a growing trend in live participation.
"Pushpa 2 has dominated the buzz and attention this year, solidifying its position in Telugu cinema history."

The report indicates a strong year for Telugu cinema with a growing interest in live events and music, suggesting Post-pandemic recovery and increasing audience engagement.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Tops 2024 Ticket Sales According to BookMyShow Report

The Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) has publicly condemned Prithvi Shaw for his outburst regarding his exclusion from the Vijay Hazare Trophy. The association believes that such behavior undermines the team's integrity.

title: Amazon leaks OnePlus 13R processor details ahead of OnePlus 13 series winter launch event: Details - The Financial Express
summary:
Amazon Leaks OnePlus 13R Processor Details Ahead of OnePlus 13 Series Winter Launch Event

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Financial Express

In a recent slip, Amazon India has inadvertently disclosed the processor details for the soon-to-be-launched OnePlus 13R smartphone, which is scheduled for its debut on January 7, 2025.

  • The OnePlus 13R is confirmed to feature the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor.
  • This detail aligns with the release pattern, as the OnePlus 12R previously utilized the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2.
  • The device will sport a 6,000mAh battery and various AI functionalities for enhancing user experience.

title: 10 Hacks to reduce joint pain in winter - The Times of India
summary:
10 Hacks to Reduce Joint Pain in Winter

Date: Dec 20, 2024 | Source: Times of India

Winter can exacerbate joint pain, making every activity a chore. It is possible to reduce discomfort by keeping warm, active, and following simple lifestyle changes that will keep your joints healthy all season.

  • Keep warm by dressing in layers and using heating pads.
  • Stay active with low-impact exercises like walking and yoga.
  • Use hot and cold therapy for pain relief.
  • Avoid overexertion by breaking tasks into manageable parts.
  • Consider Vitamin D supplements to combat winter deficiency.
  • Massage therapy can improve circulation and reduce stiffness.
  • Wear joint support accessories such as knee braces.
  • Maintain a healthy weight to reduce joint strain.
  • Stay hydrated to keep joints lubricated.
  • Eat anti-inflammatory foods rich in omega-3s.
newTitle: 10 Hacks to Reduce Joint Pain in Winter

Rs 201 IPO GMP Today: Latest grey market premium on FIRE - Check company name - ET Now
summary:
Mamata Machinery IPO Shows Strong Grey Market Premium

Updated: December 20, 2024 12:52 IST | Source: ET NOW

Mamata Machinery, a Gujarat-based packaging equipment manufacturer, has seen its IPO trading at a high grey market premium, indicating potential for strong listing gains.

  • The Mamata Machinery IPO opened on December 19 and will close on December 23.
  • The IPO price band is set between Rs 230 and Rs 243.
  • The current grey market premium is Rs 201, suggesting a possible listing at Rs 444 per share, representing around an 82% gain.
  • Ahead of the IPO, the company raised Rs 53 crore from anchor investors.
  • The IPO consists entirely of an Offer for Sale (OFS) of 73.82 lakh equity shares, totaling Rs 179.38 crore at the upper price band.
  • Listing is expected on both NSE and BSE, with trading commencing thereafter.
“The Mamata Machinery shares could deliver a bumper listing gain of around 82 percent.”

Investors are advised to consider their financial positions carefully before participating in the IPO, as the article is intended for informational purposes only.
newTitle: Mamata Machinery IPO Shows Strong Grey Market Premium

title: Parliament Winter Session Day 21 Live Updates: Rajya Sabha resume; on last day of Winter Session, Lok Sabha adjourned ‘sine die’ amid Centre-Oppn uproar - The Indian Express
summary:
Parliament Winter Session Day 21 Live Updates: On last day of Winter Session, both Houses adjourned ‘sine die’ amid Centre-Oppn uproar

Date & Source: December 21, 2024 | Indian Express

On the final day of the Winter Session of Parliament, both Houses were adjourned sine die shortly after reconvening amidst a faceoff between the Centre and Opposition MPs, related to protests over comments made about B R Ambedkar.

  • The Lok Sabha adopted a resolution referring bills on simultaneous elections to a joint parliamentary committee.
  • Protests in Parliament led to a scuffle involving Opposition and BJP MPs.
  • Two BJP MPs were reportedly injured during the confrontations.
“In a decisive move aimed at maintaining decorum, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla issued instructions that no political party or groups of MPs will be allowed to hold any protest at the gates of Parliament House.”

This session's conclusion highlights ongoing tensions between political parties in India, particularly concerning the treatment of historical figures like Dr B R Ambedkar.
newTitle: Parliament Winter Session Day 21 Concludes Amid Uproar

title: Former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala passes away in Gurugram - Hindustan Times
summary:
Former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala passes away in Gurugram

Date: December 20, 2024

Source: HT News Desk

Om Prakash Chautala, the former chief minister of Haryana and Indian National Lok Dal (INLD) supremo, passed away at the age of 89 due to a cardiac arrest.

  • Chautala was last seen publicly during Haryana's Assembly elections held on October 5, 2024.
  • He was the son of former Deputy Prime Minister Chaudhary Devi Lal and served as Haryana's chief minister multiple times.
  • Chautala had a controversial political career, including jail time related to a disproportionate assets case.
  • He is survived by three daughters and two sons, with notable political figures in his family.
“Om Prakash Chautala was a prominent political figure whose career encompassed significant controversies and achievements.”

His passing marks the end of an era in Haryana politics, reflective of his father’s legacy and his lengthy career.
newTitle: Former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala passes away in Gurugram

title: Carl Pei-Led Nothing Rolls Out Android 15 Update To Nothing Phone 2 & Nothing Phone 2a, Here's What's New - ABP Live
summary:
Nothing Phone 2 and 2a Receive Android 15 Update: Key Features Revealed

Published at: 20 Dec 2024 12:24 PM (IST) | Source: ABP Live

London-based smartphone brand Nothing has started rolling out its Android 15-based Nothing OS 3.0 update to select devices. The update brings several new features, including a built-in gallery app, redesigned lock screen and home screen widgets, and an AI-powered Smart Drawer.

Key Points

  • The update enhances camera features, improving portrait effects and low-light performance.
  • A native gallery app with enhanced search and editing capabilities is now included.
  • Improvements to multitasking through an enhanced pop-up view.
  • Lock screen customization options have been expanded.
  • Introduction of Shared Widgets for interaction between devices.
  • New productivity-focused widgets, including a Countdown Widget.
  • The AI-powered Smart Drawer intelligently organizes apps for easier access.
  • Updates to the Quick Settings menu for better usability.
“Effortlessly intuitive. Dive into Nothing OS 3.0, now available on Phone (2) and Phone (2a).” — Nothing (@nothing) December 18, 2024

The rollout is happening in stages and will reach all users soon, with plans to expand updates to other models in early 2025.
newTitle: Nothing Phone 2 and 2a Receive Android 15 Update: Key Features Revealed

title: Realme 14 Pro colour changing design revealed ahead of India launch- All details - Hindustan Times
summary:
Realme 14 Pro to become the world’s first colour-changing smartphone, here’s everything you need to know.

Publication Date: Dec 20, 2024Source: Hindustan Times

The Realme 14 Pro is set to launch in India soon, showcasing a unique color-changing design that has generated significant buzz in the smartphone industry.

  • The Realme 14 Pro features a innovative color-changing back panel.
  • It has received several IP ratings (P66, IP68, IP69) for durability against water and dust.
  • The smartphone is designed with a circular camera module and enhanced camera technology dubbed MagicGlow.
  • The color-changing effect activates below 16 degrees Celsius, created in collaboration with Valeur Designers.
  • The global launch is expected in January 2025, with other brands also launching new models around the same time.
“The Realme 14 Pro will become the world’s first color-changing smartphone.”

This innovative design positions Realme as a frontrunner in smartphone technology, potentially reshaping market competitiveness and consumer expectations.

title: Flat Earther YouTuber's Myth Busted After He Spends $37,000 On Trip To Antarctica | WATCH - NewsX
summary:
Flat Earther YouTuber’s Myth Busted After He Spends $37,000 On Trip To Antarctica | WATCH

Publication Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: NewsX

Flat Earther YouTuber Jeran Campanella shattered his beliefs about the Earth's shape after a $37,000 trip to Antarctica where he witnessed the 24-hour sun phenomenon, prompting a significant shift in his long-held theory.

Key Points:

  • Jeran Campanella traveled nearly 14,000 miles to Antarctica to validate his Flat Earth beliefs.
  • He discovered the reality of the Midnight Sun, challenging his previous notions about the sun's movement.
  • Campanella admitted, "Sometimes you are wrong in life. I thought there was no 24-hour sun."
  • A local pastor organized “The Final Experiment” to provide evidence against the Flat Earth theory.
  • Despite existing evidence, some still cling to the Flat Earth theory.
“What does it mean? You’ll have to figure it out. To me, it means that the AE map no longer works, but that doesn’t mean that I’m right.” — Jeran Campanella

This trip not only transformed Campanella's perspective but also sparked discussions about the Flat Earth theory's validity.
newTitle: Flat Earther YouTuber Admits Earth Is Not Flat After $37,000 Trip to Antarctica

title: The Moon might be older than scientists previously thought — a new study shines light on its history - Down To Earth Magazine
summary:
The Moon might be older than scientists previously thought — a new study shines light on its history

Published on: 20 Dec 2024, 6:23 am

The study discusses how new perspectives on the Moon's history may change scientists' understanding of its formation. The research explores tidal heating effects and challenges existing estimations concerning the Moon's age.

  • The Moon's formation is linked to a Mars-sized object colliding with Earth.
  • Initial Moon rocks suggest the Moon is about 4.35 billion years old, but this may not reflect its actual age.
  • The research proposes that tidal heating might reset radiometric clocks in lunar rocks.
  • Further analysis and samples from ongoing lunar missions may provide clarity on the Moon's formation timeline.
“If the Moon warmed up enough, its clocks would lose their memory and would start recording time only once the Moon cooled down again.”

The implications of these findings could reshape our understanding of planetary formation and the early solar system's dynamics.
newTitle: New Study Suggests the Moon Is Older Than Previously Thought

Race against time: US govt may shut down on Friday; what does it mean? - Hindustan Times
summary:
US Government Faces Shutdown as Debt Ceiling Debate Intensifies

Date: Today | Source: Hindustan Times

The US government faces a shutdown as lawmakers are unable to agree on a temporary funding plan amidst a significant debt ceiling crisis.

  • The Republican-led House rejected a temporary funding plan backed by President-elect Donald Trump.
  • The bill failed with a vote of 235 to 174, reflecting division among Republicans.
  • Trump is demanding a provision to raise the debt limit be included in any funding legislation.
  • If the debt ceiling is not raised, it could lead to default and severe economic disruption.
  • Speaker of the House Mike Johnson faces pressure as he navigates this critical issue.
  • Key figures like Representative Chip Roy and Elon Musk have influenced the debate, voicing strong criticisms of proposed plans.
"To congratulate yourself because it’s shorter in pages but increases the debt by $5 trillion is asinine." - Representative Chip Roy

As the deadline approaches, the nation awaits a resolution to avert a government shutdown and its possible repercussions.
newTitle: US Government Faces Shutdown as Debt Ceiling Debate Intensifies
